H0.text: A 'Loganberry' is a cross between two berries, name either. Blueberry

H1.text: A 'Loganberry' is a cross between two berries, name either. Cranberry

H2.text: A 'Loganberry' is a cross between two berries, name either. Elderberry

H3.text: A 'Loganberry' is a cross between two berries, name either. RASPBERRY or BLACKBERRY

A4.text: The loganberry (Rubus Ã— loganobaccus) is a hybrid of the North American blackberry (Rubus ursinus) and the European raspberry (Rubus idaeus), accidentally bred in 1881 by James Harvey Logan, for whom they are named.

A5.text: The loganberry was derived from a cross between Rubus ursinus (R. vitifolius) 'Aughinbaugh' (octaploid) as the female parent and Rubus idaeus 'Red Antwerp' (diploid) as the male parent (pollen source); the loganberry is hexaploid.
